summary: This is an internal FBI email from July 20, 2019, coordinating the multi-faceted investigation into Jeffrey Epstein. It discusses evidence collection (CART imaging, financial analysis), potential charges (forfeiture, child pornography), planning for a search warrant on Epstein's island, victim services coordination, and specific evidentiary questions regarding seized images and binders.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Referred to as JE. The email discusses evidence seized from his NY residence, images of him with minors, and the potential for a search warrant on his island.

persons.name: ASAC Casale
persons.context: Mentioned as assuring the email author that he will surge additional bodies to the forfeiture investigation if needed.

persons.name: SAC
persons.context: Described as being fully supportive of requests for overtime (OT) for the investigation.

connections.description: ASAC Casale is involved in resourcing the FBI's forfeiture investigation into Epstein.

events.title: FBI internal coordination on Epstein investigation
events.description: FBI email sent to coordinate multiple investigative strands including digital forensics (CART), financial analysis, forfeiture, potential search warrant for Epstein's island, and victim services.

events.title: CART imaging of Epstein's digital devices
events.description: FBI's Computer Analysis Response Team (CART) is working over the weekend to image all digital devices seized from Epstein.

events.title: Planned follow-up on CP evidence and binders
events.description: The email author requests answers by early Monday (July 22) regarding the number of potential child pornography images and details about binders of victim names found in a closet.

keyFacts: The FBI and SDNY were coordinating a complex investigation with multiple components: forfeiture, digital forensics (CART), and financial analysis (led by an SDNY vendor).
Investigators were actively considering seeking a search warrant for Jeffrey Epstein's island based on victim statements, open-source reporting, and seized images from New York.

The FBI was evaluating potential child pornography charges based on seized 'full frontal images' and context including pictures/paintings in Epstein's residence and allegations of him masturbating next to minors.
Investigators found binders of names in a closet and were trying to determine if they contained names of Florida-based victims or only New York-based victims.
The FBI was tracking and servicing 59 victims at the time, emphasizing victim interviews and the need for Victim Specialists to be present.
